The purpose of the patent is to provide a method of making large structural one-piece parts of metal, particularly one-piece shafts. The context of the patent is large diameter metal shafts for turbines and electric generators, and other large structural metal parts, can be made in one piece to a high quality without occlusions, cavities, segregations, and cracks by building the part up layer by layer, each layer being formed by deposition of molten metal by welding along neighbouring tracks which together cover the area over which the layer is to be deposited. The weld deposition of the metal may be effected by a welding head which is moved longitudinally along the part, and if the part is simultaneously rotated the metal is deposited along a helical path in forming a layer.
